<TH WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH WIDTH="20%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Per Square Foot</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
<TH WIDTH="27%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH WIDTH="24%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Monthly Base Rent</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="21%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>13</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="20%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>[***]</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="27%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="24%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>[***]</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="21%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>14</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="20%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>[***]</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="27%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="24%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>[***]</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE></DIV>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
addition, with respect to the rentable square feet of the Building leased by Tenant exceeding 40,000 rentable square feet, excluding the Ground Satellite Area and DC
Play Area, the Base Rent for the final two years of the extended Primary Lease Term shall be as follows: </FONT></P>
</UL>
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><TABLE WIDTH="29%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TH WIDTH="21%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Lease Year</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
<TH WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH WIDTH="20%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Per Square Foot</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
<TH WIDTH="27%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH WIDTH="24%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Monthly Base Rent</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="21%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>13</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="20%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>[***]</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="27%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="24%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>[***]</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="21%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>14</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="20%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>[***]</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="27%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="24%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>[***]</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE></DIV>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No
rent shall be payable with respect to Tenant's lease of the Ground Satellite Area and DC Play Area during the 13th and 14th Lease Years. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Permitted Use.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;1.11 of the Lease is amended in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Permitted Use.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>(i)&nbsp;General office; (ii)&nbsp;telephone reservation center; (iii)&nbsp;classroom training; (iv)&nbsp;flight
simulator training; (v)&nbsp;flight attendant training with associated equipment; (vi)&nbsp;dispatch center; (vii)&nbsp;records storage; (viii)&nbsp;cafeteria only for employees;
(ix)&nbsp;exercise area
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2159467",CP="FRONTIER AIRLINES, INC.",DN="4",CHK=619332,FOLIO='1',FILE='DISK122:[05DEN6.05DEN2116]SO2116A.;5',USER='DTAYLOR',CD='14-JUN-2005;10:55' -->
<A NAME="page_so2116_1_2"> </A>
only for employees; and (x)&nbsp;day care center and for no other purpose; provided, however, at no time during the Primary Lease Term as it may be extended, may more than fifteen percent (15%) of
the Rentable Area of the Premises at any time, be used for uses (viii)&nbsp;through (x)&nbsp;above. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Basic Provisions; Premises, Parking and Common Areas.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;1.4
is amended to provide that the number of parking spaces is 317. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;1.9
is amended in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>One
hundred percent (100%). </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Landlord
has completed Landlord's Work, Tenant has accepted the Premises, and the same are acceptable to Tenant in all respects. Sections 2.2 and 2.3 and
Exhibit&nbsp;C are deleted from the Lease. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;2.4
is amended to delete subsections (iii)&nbsp;and (iv)&nbsp;thereof. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Delay in Possession.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;3.2 of the Lease is deleted in its entirety. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Operating Expenses.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
first paragraph of Section&nbsp;4.2 is amended in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Tenant
shall pay to Landlord during the Term hereof, in addition to the Base Rent, Tenant's Share (as specified in Section&nbsp;1.9) of all Operating Expenses, as hereinafter defined, incurred by
Landlord during each calendar year of the Term of this Lease, in accordance with the following provisions: </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;4.2(a)(iii)&nbsp;is
amended to delete "property management." </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;4.2(a)(iv)&nbsp;is
amended in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>(iv)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
costs of capital improvements, structural repairs and replacements in or to the Building Complex not otherwise specifically required to be responsibility or liability of Landlord
under this Lease ("Capital Improvements"); the costs of Capital Improvements, structural repairs and replacements in or to the Building Complex in order to conform to changes subsequent to the
Commencement Date in any Applicable Laws, ordinances, rules, regulations or orders of any governmental or quasi governmental authority having jurisdiction over the Building Complex (the "Required
Capital Improvements"); the costs of any Capital Improvements, structural repairs and replacements designed primarily to reduce any Operating Expenses (the "Cost Savings Improvements"); and the costs
of roof replacement to the extent not covered by warranty ("Roof Replacement"). The expenditures for Capital Improvements, Roof Replacement, Required Capital Improvements and Cost Savings Improvements
shall be amortized at a market rate of return over the useful life of such item as determined by Landlord's accountants. Capital Improvements and Required Capital Improvements shall not include the
initial costs of building expansions for purposes of determining operating expenses. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;4.2(b)(vi)&nbsp;is
amended by adding, at the beginning, the words, "Property management expenses and". </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Maintenance, Repairs, Utility Installations, Trade Fixtures and Alterations.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;8.1(a)
is amended in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Subject
to the provisions of Sections 8.2, 10, and 15, Tenant shall, at Tenant's sole cost and expense and at all times, keep the Building Complex and every part thereof in good order, condition and
repair (whether or not the need for such repairs occurs as a result of Tenant's
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2159467",CP="FRONTIER AIRLINES, INC.",DN="4",CHK=898783,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK122:[05DEN6.05DEN2116]SO2116A.;5',USER='DTAYLOR',CD='14-JUN-2005;10:55' -->
<A NAME="page_so2116_1_3"> </A>
use, any prior use, the elements or the age of such portion of the Building Complex), including, without limiting the generality of the foregoing, plumbing, electrical lighting facilities, boilers,
fired or unfired pressure vessels, fire hose connections, fixtures, interior walls, exterior walls, roof, ceilings, floors, windows, doors, plate glass, and skylights, parking areas and lighting,
driveways, sidewalks, landscaping, irrigation systems, and subject to Section&nbsp;8.1(b) below, heating, air conditioning and ventilating systems, but excluding any items which are the
responsibility of Landlord pursuant to Section&nbsp;8.2 below. Tenant, in keeping the Building Complex in good order, condition and repair, shall exercise and perform good maintenance practices,
including, without limitation, providing janitorial services to the Building Complex substantially equivalent to those attached hereto as Exhibit&nbsp;I and, snow, ice and trash removal service.
Tenant's obligations shall include restorations, replacements or renewals when necessary to keep the Building Complex and all improvements thereon or a part thereof in good order, condition and state
of repair. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;8.1(b)
is amended in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Tenant
shall procure and pay the cost of a contract for maintenance of the heating, air conditioning and ventilating systems for the Building Complex with a reputable contractor licensed in the State
of Colorado and reasonably satisfactory to Landlord. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;8.1(c)
is amended to replace, in both places where it is used, the word "Premises" with the words "Building Complex" and to add the words "including,
without limitation, the Premises," before the words "after twenty". </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;8.2
is amended in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>By Landlord.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Subject to the provisions of Sections 4.2, 6, 8.1, 9, 10, 11 and 15, and except for damage caused by any negligent or
intentional act or omission of Tenant, its agents, employees, suppliers or invitees, in which event Tenant shall repair the damage, Landlord shall (a)&nbsp;keep in good order, condition and repair
the structural components of the Building Complex, including, but not limited to, foundations and structural condition of exterior walls and interior bearing walls, if any; provided, however, Landlord
shall not be obligated to paint or provide routine maintenance of the interior or exterior surfaces of exterior walls or of interior bearing walls nor shall Landlord be obligated to maintain, repair
or replace windows, doors or plate glass of the Premises; and (b)&nbsp;replace the roof when it is reasonably necessary to do so. Tenant shall have no right to make repairs to the Building or
Building Complex at Landlord's expense except as otherwise provided herein, including, but not limited to Sections&nbsp;8.1, 10.6 or 14.5. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sections
8.3(a) and (b)&nbsp;are each amended by deleting "[***]" and substituting "[***]". </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Insurance; Indemnity</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;9.2(a)
is amended in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Carried by Tenant.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Tenant shall obtain and keep in force during the Term of this Lease a General Liability policy of insurance (including
but not limited to third party bodily injury, personal injury, property damage, and premises liability) protecting Tenant against claims based upon, involving or arising out of their use, occupancy or
maintenance of the Premises and all areas appurtenant thereto. Such insurance shall be on an occurrence basis providing single limit coverage in an amount of not less than five million dollars
($5,000,000) per occurrence, except in the annual aggregate as respects personal injury. The policy shall (i)&nbsp;name Landlord and Lender(s) whose names have been provided to Tenant in writing as
additional insureds for their interests (ii)&nbsp;contain several liability and cross liability clauses in favor of Landlord and any such Lender(s), (iii)&nbsp;include coverage for liability
assumed under
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=3,EFW="2159467",CP="FRONTIER AIRLINES, INC.",DN="4",CHK=245605,FOLIO='3',FILE='DISK122:[05DEN6.05DEN2116]SO2116A.;5',USER='DTAYLOR',CD='14-JUN-2005;10:55' -->
<A NAME="page_so2116_1_4"> </A>
this Lease as an "insured contract" for the performance of Tenant's indemnity obligations under this Lease, and (iv)&nbsp;including coverage for liability arising from acts of terrorism to the
extent available from or with the assistance of the U.S. government or from private carriers on commercially reasonable terms. The limits of said insurance required by this lease or as carried by
Tenant shall not, however, limit the liability of Tenant nor relieve Tenant of any obligations hereunder. All insurance to be carried by Tenant shall be primary to and not contributory with any
similar insurance carried by Landlord, whose insurance shall be considered excess insurance only. In addition, Tenant shall maintain workers' compensation insurance as is required by state law. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
first sentence of Section&nbsp;9.3 is amended in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Subject
to reimbursement of premiums as described in Section&nbsp;9.1, Landlord shall maintain property damage insurance on the Building and the common areas insuring against loss or damage by fire
or other casualty covered by a so-called "special form" policy and insuring loss or damage by acts of terrorism, in such amounts and from companies and on terms and conditions as Landlord
deems appropriate from time to time. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
next to the last sentence of Section&nbsp;9.4 is amended to read as follows: No such policy shall be cancelable or subject to modification adverse to the interests
of Landlord except after thirty (30)&nbsp;days' (ten (10)&nbsp;days' for non-payment of premium) prior written notice to Landlord. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;9.6(a)
is amended to add the words "reasonable" before the words "attorneys"'. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Payment of Taxes.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;11.1 is amended by adding the following sentence: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Tenant
shall have the right, at its sole cost and expense, to protest any Real Property Taxes, and Landlord agrees to cooperate in said protest without expense to the Landlord, provided however that
the foregoing right to protest shall not affect Landlord's right to pay any such Real Property Taxes before or during the pendency of Tenant's protest or Tenant's obligation to reimburse Landlord for
payment of such Real Property Taxes. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Utilities.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;12 is amended in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Utilities.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Tenant shall pay directly for all utilities and services supplied to the Building Complex, including, but not limited to
electricity, telephone, security, gas and cleaning of the Building Complex as described in Section&nbsp;8.1 herein together with any taxes thereon. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;11.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Assignment and Subletting.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;13.1
is amended in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Assignment.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Tenant shall not assign this Lease or any interest herein without the written consent of Landlord first being obtained, which
consent will not be unreasonably withheld provided that: (i)&nbsp;Tenant has complied with the applicable provisions of Section&nbsp;13.3 below and Landlord has declined to exercise its rights
thereunder; (ii)&nbsp;the proposed assignee is engaged in a business, and the Premises will be used, in a manner which is in keeping with the then standards of the Building and the Permitted Uses
provided in Section&nbsp;1.11 and does not conflict with any exclusive use rights granted to any other tenant; (iii)&nbsp;the proposed assignee has reasonable financial worth in light of the
responsibilities involved and Tenant shall have provided Landlord with reasonable evidence thereof; (iv)&nbsp;Tenant is not in monetary default or material non-monetary default hereunder
at the time it makes its request for such consent; (v)&nbsp;the proposed assignee is not a governmental or quasi governmental agency; (vi)&nbsp;the rent under such assignment is not less than the
rent to be paid by Tenant for such space under the Lease; and (vii)&nbsp;any lender of Landlord from whom Landlord must obtain consent has provided such consent in writing. Notwithstanding anything
contained herein to the contrary,
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=4,EFW="2159467",CP="FRONTIER AIRLINES, INC.",DN="4",CHK=167267,FOLIO='4',FILE='DISK122:[05DEN6.05DEN2116]SO2116A.;5',USER='DTAYLOR',CD='14-JUN-2005;10:55' -->
<A NAME="page_so2116_1_5"> </A>
Tenant acknowledges that if the use of the Premises by any proposed assignee would require compliance by Landlord and the Building with any current or future laws to a greater extent than that
required prior to the proposed occupancy by such assignee, Landlord, at its sole option, may refuse to grant such consent, unless, as an express condition thereof, Tenant and/or such assignee bears
the entire cost of such greater compliance. Subject to Section&nbsp;13.7 below, a sale by Tenant of all or substantially all of its assets or, if Tenant is a publicly traded corporation, all or
substantially all of its stock; a merger of Tenant with another corporation; the transfer of twenty-five percent (25%) or more of Tenant's stock if Tenant is not a publicly traded
corporation; or transfer of twenty-five percent (25%) or more of the direct or indirect beneficial ownership interests in Tenant if Tenant is not a publicly traded corporation shall
constitute an assignment hereunder requiring Landlord's prior written consent. Notwithstanding the consent of Landlord to any assignment, Tenant shall not be relieved from its primary obligations
hereunder to Landlord, including, but not limited to those provided in Section&nbsp;8.1 and to the payment of all Base Rent and Tenant's Share of Operating Expenses, unless in its consent Landlord
has specifically agreed to release Tenant from such obligations. If this Lease is assigned, Landlord may collect the rent from the assignee and apply the net amount collected to the Rent herein
reserved. Any attempt by Tenant to assign this Lease as to less than all of the Premises shall be considered a subletting and shall be subject to the terms of Section&nbsp;13.2 below. If Tenant
collects any rental or other amounts from any assignee in excess of assumption of the obligation to pay Base Rent and the Tenant's Share of Operating Expenses, Landlord shall be entitled to fifty
percent (50%) of such excess after deducting actual payments by Tenant for brokerage commissions and tenant improvement costs on account of such assignment, and Tenant shall pay to Landlord, as and
when Tenant receives the same, all such excess amounts received by Tenant. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;13.2
is amended in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Subletting.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Tenant shall not sublet any part of the Premises without the written consent of Landlord first being obtained, which consent
Landlord may grant or withhold in Landlord's sole discretion in the case of a subletting of fifty percent (50%) or more of the Premises, but which consent as to any subletting of less than fifty
percent (50%) of the Premises will not be unreasonably withheld. Tenant agrees that the factors enumerated in subsections (i)&nbsp;through (v)&nbsp;and (vii)&nbsp;of Section&nbsp;13.1 above
are among the factors upon which Landlord may reasonably decide to withhold consent to a subletting. If the Premises or any part thereof is sublet or occupied by anybody other than Tenant (other than
an assignee), Landlord may, after a default by Tenant, collect the rent from the subtenant or occupant and apply the net amount collected to the Rent herein reserved. No such subletting, occupancy, or
collection shall be deemed an acceptance of the subtenant or occupant as the tenant hereof or a release of Tenant from further performance by Tenant of covenants on the part of Tenant herein
contained. Notwithstanding the consent of Landlord to any sublease, Tenant shall not be relieved from its primary obligations hereunder to Landlord, including, but not limited to those provided in
Section&nbsp;8.1 and to the payment of all Base Rent and Tenant's Share of Operating Expenses. If Landlord or Tenant collects any rental or other amounts from any subtenant or occupant (on a
per-square-foot-basis) in excess of the Base Rent and the Tenant's Share of Operating Expenses for any monthly period, Landlord shall be entitled to fifty percent
(50%) of such excess after deducting actual payments by Tenant for brokerage commissions and tenant improvement costs on account of such subletting or occupancy, and Tenant shall pay to Landlord on a
monthly basis, as and when Tenant receives the same, all such excess amounts received by Tenant.
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=5,EFW="2159467",CP="FRONTIER AIRLINES, INC.",DN="4",CHK=641375,FOLIO='5',FILE='DISK122:[05DEN6.05DEN2116]SO2116A.;5',USER='DTAYLOR',CD='14-JUN-2005;10:55' -->
<A NAME="page_so2116_1_6"> </A></FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;13.3
is amended by deleting the word "such" after the word "consent" in (ii)&nbsp;and by the addition of the following new sentence: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Landlord's
consent to any requested sublease or assignment shall not in any way be construed as relieving Tenant from obtaining Landlord's express written consent to any further assignment or sublease
and shall not waive Landlord's right to refuse to consent to any other such request or to terminate this Lease if such request is made, all as provided herein. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;12.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Inducement Recapture in Event of Default.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;14.3 is deleted in its entirety. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;13.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Default by Landlord.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;14.5 is amended by the addition of the following: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Notwithstanding
the foregoing, in the event of an emergency (i.e., an immediate threat of material harm to person or to property of Tenant) and Landlord's failure within a reasonable time after
Tenant's notice of such emergency to comply with the terms of Section&nbsp;8.2, Tenant shall have the right, but not the obligation, to complete such repairs and shall be entitled to reimbursement
from Landlord for the expenses and costs incurred by Tenant in completing such repairs. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;14.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Financial Statement.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;17.2 is amended by adding the following new sentence: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
foregoing requirement shall not apply if, at the time of any request by Landlord for Tenant's financial statements, Tenant is a publicly-traded company and such financial statements have been
filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission and are matters of public record. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;15.</FONT><FONT

entirety to read as follows: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;18.</FONT><FONT

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;50.4
of the Lease is amended to change "twenty-five percent (25%)" to "fifty percent (50%)." </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;50.5
of the Lease is amended to delete "but in no event shall the rate be less than the Base Rent which Tenant is paying immediately prior to commencement
of the respective Option Term" and by adding "in the same vicinity as the Building Complex" after the phrase "comparable building complex" in the second sentence. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;19.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Condition Precedent.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Amendment shall be effective on the date of, and only upon, conveyance of title to
the Building Complex by Landlord to Todd Family Partnership, L.P. and affiliates thereof. If such conveyance does not occur on or before December&nbsp;31, 2004, this Amendment shall be null and
void, the Lease shall remain in effect on the terms stated therein, and Landlord and Tenant shall have no further rights or obligations hereunder. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;20.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Miscellaneous.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Capitalized
terms that are not defined in this Amendment shall have the meanings ascribed to such terms in the Lease. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
there is any conflict between the terms and provisions of this Amendment and the terms and provisions of the Lease, the terms and provisions of this Amendment shall
govern. Except as herein specifically set forth, all other provisions of the Lease shall remain in full force and effect and be binding upon the parties in accordance with their terms. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="34%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">

<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

</TR>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.21
<SEQUENCE>5
<FILENAME>a2159467zex-10_21.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 10.21
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#05DEN2116_5">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10.21  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ra2116_executive_bonus_plan_#151;fy06"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ra2116_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXECUTIVE BONUS PLAN&#151;FY06    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;So long as the Company achieves a minimum profit margin for FY06, as more fully described below, qualifying executives of the Company will be awarded a bonus in
accordance with the following computations: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Base Bonus  </I></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Base Bonus will be equal to the executive's base salary earned during the fiscal year times a Base Bonus Percentage assigned by the Board to his or her
position. For FY06, the Base Bonus Percentage for each executive position is as set forth below: </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><TABLE WIDTH="64%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TH WIDTH="78%" ALIGN="LEFT"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Title<BR> </B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
<TH WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH WIDTH="16%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Bonus Percentage</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
<TH WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="78%"><FONT SIZE=2>President&nbsp;&amp; CEO</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="16%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>75</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>%</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="78%"><FONT SIZE=2>Senior Vice President&nbsp;&amp; Chief Operating Officer</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="16%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>65</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>%</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="78%"><FONT SIZE=2>Senior Vice President&nbsp;&amp; Chief Financial Officer</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="16%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>65</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>%</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="78%"><FONT SIZE=2>Senior Vice President&#151;In-Flight and Administrative Services</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="16%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>55</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>%</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="78%"><FONT SIZE=2>Vice President</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="16%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>45</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>%</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="78%"><FONT SIZE=2>Senior Directors</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="16%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>30</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>%</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="78%"><FONT SIZE=2>Directors</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="16%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>20</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>%</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE></DIV>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Profit Adjustment  </I></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Base Bonus will then be adjusted based on the pre-tax profit margin achieved by the Company for the fiscal year as follows: </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>PAB </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;= </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>BB</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&times;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>APM</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>/</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>TPM</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, where
</FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>PAB</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>=</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="89%"><FONT SIZE=2>The executive's Profit Adjusted Bonus</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>BB</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>=</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="89%"><FONT SIZE=2>The executive's Base Bonus</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>APM</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>=</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="89%"><FONT SIZE=2>The Company's pre-tax profit margin, expressed as a percentage, adjusted for unusual items as approved by the Board, as subject to the Maximum Profit Margin described below</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>TPM</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>=</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="89%"><FONT SIZE=2>The Target Pre-Tax Profit Margin as established by the Board for the fiscal year</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->


<P><FONT SIZE=2>provided,
no executive will be paid a bonus unless the Company's </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>APM</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> is at least equal to or greater than a Minimum Profit Margin
(</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>mPM</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>), and the APM cannot exceed a Maximum Profit Margin (</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>MPM</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>), each as established by the Board for the
fiscal year. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
the Company's FY06, the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>TPM</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> is 8%, the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>mPM</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> is 2% and the </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>MPM</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> is 12%. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Competitive Performance Adjustment  </I></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Profit Adjusted Bonus for each executive will be further adjusted based on the Company's financial performance in certain categories compared to a peer group
of competitors, each as determined by the Board in advance of the fiscal year, and calculated as follows: </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>CAB</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;= </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>PAB</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&times;&nbsp;(</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>PR</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>/50%),
where </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="6%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>CAB</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>=</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="90%"><FONT SIZE=2>Competitive Adjusted Bonus</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="6%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>PAB</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>=</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="90%"><FONT SIZE=2>Profit Adjusted Bonus</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="6%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>PR</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>=</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="90%"><FONT SIZE=2>The Company's percentile ranking against the Peer Group in the performance category selected by the Board for the fiscal year</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->


<P><FONT SIZE=2>provided,
the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>PAB</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> will not be adjusted below a minimum performance adjustment factor (</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>mPF</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>) or above a
maximum performance adjustment factor (</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>MPF</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>) as established by the Board in advance of the fiscal year.
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2159467",CP="FRONTIER AIRLINES, INC.",DN="5",CHK=317463,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK122:[05DEN6.05DEN2116]RA2116A.;11',USER='DTAYLOR',CD='14-JUN-2005;10:55' -->
<A NAME="page_ra2116_1_2"> </A></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
FY06, the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Peer Group</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> is all major and low-cost airlines not operating under bankruptcy protection at any time during the
measurement period; the performance category is Pre-Tax Profit Margin as calculated under GAAP for the 12&nbsp;month period equal to the Company's fiscal year, excluding extraordinary
items; </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>mPF</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> is .5 if the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>PR</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> is equal to or less than 25%; and </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>MPF</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> is 1.5 if the </FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>PR</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> is equal to or greater than 75%. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Discretionary Adjustment  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The CAB for any executive officer may be further increased or decreased by the Board in its sole discretion by anywhere from 0% to 20% based on individual
performance. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding
any provision of this Bonus Plan, the decision to grant a bonus to any employee of the Company and the terms and conditions of such bonus will rest with the Board in its
sole discretion. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2159467",CP="FRONTIER AIRLINES, INC.",DN="5",CHK=455964,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK122:[05DEN6.05DEN2116]RA2116A.;11',USER='DTAYLOR',CD='14-JUN-2005;10:55' -->
</FONT></P>

<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<BR>
<P><br><A NAME="05DEN2116_5">QuickLinks</A><br></P><!-- TOC_BEGIN -->
<FONT SIZE=2><A HREF="#toc_ra2116_1">EXECUTIVE BONUS PLAN&#151;FY06</A></FONT><BR>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.22
<SEQUENCE>6
<FILENAME>a2159467zex-10_22.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 10.22
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#05DEN2116_6">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10.22  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="rm2116_long_term_incentive_plan_#151;fy06"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_rm2116_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>LONG TERM INCENTIVE PLAN&#151;FY06    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Qualifying officers and directors of the Company will participate in the Company's Long Term Incentive Plan in accordance with the provisions set forth below.
Elements of incentive compensation that may be awarded to qualifying officers and directors include Stock Options ("Options"), Stock-Only Stock Appreciation Rights ("SOSARs"), and
Restricted Stock Units ("RSUs"), each issued in accordance with the terms and provisions of the Frontier Airlines 2004 Equity Incentive Plan (the "2004 Plan")., as well as Cash-Based
Incentives ("CBIs"). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;It
is the general intent of the Company's Long Term Incentive Plan to provide the Company's officers and directors with a package of incentives that equate to 110% of the value of the
incentive paid by comparably positioned employees at other airlines contained in the Company's peer group, as that peer group is identified by the Board from time to time (the "Peer Group"), subject
to adjustment &plusmn;10% based on individual performance. Prior to the beginning of each fiscal year, the Board, acting on the recommendations of the Compensation
Committee, will determine the Peer Group and total value of Options, SOSARs, RSUs and CBIs to be granted to each qualifying officer, senior director and director for the coming fiscal year. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under
the Plan, a mix of Options or SOSARs, RSUs and CBIs will be available for award to Officers of the Company and CBIs and RSUs will be available for award to Senior Directors and
Directors of the Company. Of the total value of the incentive awards granted to Officers, it is intended that 40% will be represented by the value of granted Options or SOSARs, 40% will be represented
by the value of CBIs, and 20% will be represented by the value of the RSUs. Of the total value of the incentive awards granted to Senior Directors and Directors, 60% will be represented by the value
of CBIs, and 40% will be represented by the value of the RSUs. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
dates on which incentives become exercisable or are earned or payable will be determined by the Board or the Committee administering the 2004 Plan in its sole discretion. Generally,
however, it is intended that Options and SOSARs will become exercisable in five equal installments, with the first installment becoming exercisable on the first anniversary of the date of grant and
remaining installments becoming exercisable on the next four anniversaries of such date, and RSUs will become exercisable in a single installment on the fifth anniversary of the date of grant. CBIs
will be paid as soon as possible at the end of thee fiscal&nbsp;years from the time the CBIs are awarded. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Special Rules&nbsp;for Cash-Based Incentives  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The value of the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>CBI</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> identified for an individual officer, senior director or director in the advance of each
fiscal year is will be the target </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>CBI</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> ("</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>TCBI</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") for such individual. The amount of the </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>TCBI</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> paid to the
individual at the end of </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Performance Period</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (as defined below) will be adjusted as
follows: </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ACBI</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;= </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>TCBI</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&times;&nbsp;(</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>PR</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>/50%),
where </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ACBI</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>=</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="89%"><FONT SIZE=2>Actual Cash-Based Incentive paid to the employee</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>TCBI</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>=</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="89%"><FONT SIZE=2>Target Cash-Based Incentive</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>PR</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>=</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="89%"><FONT SIZE=2>The Company's percentile ranking against the Peer Group in the long-term incentive performance category (the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>LTIPC</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") over the performance period ("</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Performance Period</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), each as determined by the Board for the fiscal year</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->


<P><FONT SIZE=2>provided,
no </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>CBI</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> will be paid to any individual if the Company's performance if the Company's performance in the </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>LTIPC</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> over the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Performance
Period</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> does not exceed a minimum target (the
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>PCMT</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), and provided further that if the Company's performance over the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Performance Period</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> does exceed
the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>PCMT</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ACBI</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> will not be adjusted below a minimum performance adjustment factor
(</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>mPF</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>) or above a maximum performance adjustment factor (</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>MPF</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>) as established by the Board in advance of
the fiscal year.
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2159467",CP="FRONTIER AIRLINES, INC.",DN="6",CHK=956415,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK122:[05DEN6.05DEN2116]RM2116A.;7',USER='DTAYLOR',CD='14-JUN-2005;10:55' -->
<A NAME="page_rm2116_1_2"> </A></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
FY06, the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Peer Group</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> is all major and low-cost airlines not operating under bankruptcy protection at any time during the </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>Performance Period</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>; the
</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Performance Period</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> is the 36&nbsp;month period equating to the Company's FY06,
FY07 and FY08; </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>LTIPC</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> is the annual Pre-Tax Profit Margin as calculated under GAAP for the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Performance
Period</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, excluding extraordinary items; </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>PCMT</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> is 4%; the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>mPF</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> is .5 when the PR is
equal to or less than 25%; and </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>MPF</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> is 1.5 when the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>PR</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> is equal to or greater than 75%. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding
any provision of this Long-Term Incentive Plan, the decision to grant long term incentive compensation to any employee of the Company and the terms and
conditions of such grant, will rest with the Board in its sole discretion. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2159467",CP="FRONTIER AIRLINES, INC.",DN="6",CHK=888614,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK122:[05DEN6.05DEN2116]RM2116A.;7',USER='DTAYLOR',CD='14-JUN-2005;10:55' -->
</FONT></P>

<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10.23  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>FRONTIER AIRLINES,&nbsp;INC.<BR>
2004 EQUITY INCENTIVE PLAN  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ta2116_stock_appreciation_rights_agreement"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ta2116_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>STOCK APPRECIATION RIGHTS AGREEMENT    <BR>    </I></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>THIS STOCK APPRECIATION RIGHTS AGREEMENT</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> ("Agreement") is made as
of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;, 2005 (the"Grant Date"), by
and between Frontier Airlines,&nbsp;Inc., a Colorado corporation (together with any affiliate, the "Company"), and
the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(the "Grantee"). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Company and the Grantee therefore agree as follows: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>1.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Definitions.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The following terms, when used in this
Agreement, have the following meanings: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><B>(a)</B></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Base Price"</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means
$&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><B>(b)</B></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Business Day"</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means any day other than Saturday, Sunday or a day on which banking institutions in Denver,
Colorado, are required or authorized to be closed.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><B>(c)</B></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Cause"</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> the commission of any act of fraud, embezzlement or dishonesty by the Grantee, any unauthorized use or
disclosure by the Grantee of any confidential information or trade secrets of the Company, any other intentional misconduct by the Grantee that adversely affects the business affairs of the Company or
any other conduct that violates the Company's policies or procedures.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><B>(d)</B></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Close of Business"</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means, on any day, 5:00&nbsp;p.m., Denver, Colorado time.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><B>(e)</B></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Code"</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><B>(f)</B></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Committee"</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors of the Company.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><B>(g)</B></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Disability; Disabled"</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the status granted to a Grantee when the Grantee suffers a physical or mental
condition or illness that renders the Grantee, even with attempts by the Company to make reasonable accommodations, totally and permanently incapable of performing essential functions of his or her
job at the Company.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><B>(h)</B></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Fair Market Value"</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the closing price of the Stock on the principal exchange or market on which the Stock
is traded on the day as of which Fair Market Value is determined or, if the shares are not traded on that day, the next following trading day.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><B>(i)</B></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Plan"</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the Frontier Airlines 2004 Equity Incentive Plan.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><B>(j)</B></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Required Withholding Amount"</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means an amount that is equal to the amount of all federal, state and local taxes
required to be withheld by the Company upon exercise of a SAR, as determined by the Committee.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><B>(k)</B></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Retirement"</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the status granted to an individual who retires from employment with the Company after
completing at least ten (10)&nbsp;years of service with the Company, which need not be continuous, provided the sum of the age on the date of termination of employment plus&nbsp;years of service
equals at least 65.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><B>(l)</B></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"SAR" or "SARs"</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means, individually, a stock appreciation right and in the plural, the stock appreciations
rights granted pursuant to this Agreement.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><B>(m)</B></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Stock"</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the common stock of the Company, no par value.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><B>(n)</B></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"Term"</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the period commencing on the Grant Date and expiring on the tenth anniversary of the Grant Date. </FONT><P><FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2159467",CP="FRONTIER AIRLINES, INC.",DN="7",CHK=417539,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK122:[05DEN6.05DEN2116]TA2116A.;15',USER='DTAYLOR',CD='14-JUN-2005;10:56' -->
<A NAME="page_ta2116_1_2"> </A></FONT></P>

</DD></DL>
</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Grant of Stock Appreciation Rights.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject to the terms and
conditions herein, pursuant to the Plan the Company hereby grants to the Grantee SARs with respect to&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;shares of Stock. The SARs consist of a single SAR for each share of Stock.
The SARs
granted hereunder will be valid for the Term, subject to earlier termination as provided in Section&nbsp;7 below. Upon exercise of a SAR in accordance with this Agreement, the Company will, subject
to Section&nbsp;5 below, pay to the Grantee consideration equal to the amount, if any, by which the Fair Market Value of a share of Stock on the date of exercise exceeds the Base Price of such SAR,
subject to adjustment in accordance with Section&nbsp;11 of the Plan. The consideration shall be limited to a number of shares of Stock equal to the amount payable divided by the Fair Market Value
of a share of Stock on the date the SAR is exercised. If at any time the number of shares of Stock to be issued to the Grantee pursuant to this Agreement includes a fractional share, the number of
shares of Stock actually issued will be rounded down to the nearest whole share of Stock. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>3.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Vesting; Conditions of Exercise.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as otherwise provided
in this Agreement, SARs may not be exercised until the Grantee has completed one full year of continuous employment after the Grant Date. Thereafter, the SARs will become vested and exercisable in
increments in accordance with the following schedule, so long as the Grantee has remained in the continuous employment of the Company from the Grant Date until the Vesting Date: </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><TABLE WIDTH="63%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TH WIDTH="48%" ALIGN="LEFT"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Anniversary of the Grant Date<BR> </B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
<TH WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH WIDTH="48%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Percentage of SARs That Shall<BR>
Become Vested and Exercisable</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="48%"><FONT SIZE=2>First</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%"><FONT SIZE=2>20%</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="48%"><FONT SIZE=2>Second</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%"><FONT SIZE=2>an additional 20%</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="48%"><FONT SIZE=2>Third</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%"><FONT SIZE=2>an additional 20%</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="48%"><FONT SIZE=2>Fourth</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%"><FONT SIZE=2>an additional 20%</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="48%"><FONT SIZE=2>Fifth</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%"><FONT SIZE=2>an additional 20%</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE></DIV>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
number of SARs that are vested and exercisable shall be cumulative, so that once an SAR has become vested and exercisable, it shall continue to be vested and exercisable, in whole or
in part, for the remainder of the Term, unless terminated earlier as provided in this Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>4.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Manner of Exercise.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SARs may be exercised in whole or in part
by providing written notice (the "Notice") in the form attached hereto as Exhibit&nbsp;A or such other form as the Committee may require from time to time together with any other documentation that
the Committee may reasonably require (together, the "Notice Documents"). SARs will be considered exercised as to the number of SARs specified in the Notice on the latest of (i)&nbsp;the date of
exercise designated in the Notice, (ii)&nbsp;if the date so designated is not a Business Day, the first Business Day following such date or (iii)&nbsp;the earliest Business Day by which the
Company has received all of the Notice Documents. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>5.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Mandatory Withholding for Taxes.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Grantee acknowledges
that the Grantee is obligated to pay the Required Withholding Amount with respect to the exercise of any SARs. Grantee hereby authorizes the Company to deduct from the shares of Stock otherwise
deliverable upon exercise of any SARs a number of shares of Stock (valued at their Fair Market Value on the date of exercise) that is equal to the Required Withholding Amount. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>6.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Payment or Delivery by the Company.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As soon as practicable
after receipt of all Notice Documents, and subject to the deductions for the payment of the Required Withholding Amount, the Company will deliver or cause to be delivered to the Grantee the amount of
consideration determined under the final sentence of Section&nbsp;2 above, which consideration shall consist solely of shares of Stock (valued at their Fair Market Value on the date of exercise).
The delivery of shares of Stock will be deemed effected for all purposes when certificates representing such shares have been delivered by any of the following means: (i)&nbsp;personally to the
Grantee; (ii)&nbsp;deposited in the United States mail, addressed to the Grantee at the address indicated on the Notice, or (iv)&nbsp;as may be otherwise
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2159467",CP="FRONTIER AIRLINES, INC.",DN="7",CHK=805301,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK122:[05DEN6.05DEN2116]TA2116A.;15',USER='DTAYLOR',CD='14-JUN-2005;10:56' -->
<A NAME="page_ta2116_1_3"> </A>
designated by the Grantee in writing, provided, if the Grantee requests the shares of Stock be delivered by overnight or express courier, Grantee will be obligated to pay for the delivery charges. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>7.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Expiration and Termination.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The SARs will expire on the last
day of the Term or prior to such time as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>(a)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Termination for Cause.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the Grantee's employment by the
Company is terminated for Cause, as determined by the Company in its sole discretion, at any time during the Term, the SARs, whether or not vested, shall become void, shall be forfeited and shall
terminate immediately upon the termination of employment of the Grantee. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>(b)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Termination on Account of Disability.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the Grantee's
employment with the Company terminates by reason of Disability, the SARs will become fully vested and exercisable on the date of such termination. The SARs may be exercised by the Grantee or the
Grantee's representative until the earlier of (i)&nbsp;one year after the termination of employment or (ii)&nbsp;the end of the Term. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>(c)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Death.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the Grantee dies during the Term while still
employed by the Company, the SARs shall become fully vested and exercisable on the date of the Grantee's death if not otherwise fully vested and exercisable. The SARs may be exercised by the Grantee's
Beneficiary until the earlier of (i)&nbsp;the date that is one year after the date of death or (ii)&nbsp;the end of the Term. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>(d)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Termination Due to Retirement.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the Grantee terminates
employment on account of Retirement and the SAR is not then fully vested and exercisable, the SAR shall be vested as to (1)&nbsp;the number of shares that were vested on the anniversary of the Grant
Date immediately preceding the date of termination of employment plus (2)&nbsp;a pro rata portion of the number of additional shares that would have vested on the anniversary of the Grant Date
immediately following the date of termination of employment based on the ratio of (i)&nbsp;the number of&nbsp;days past from the prior anniversary of the Grant Date to (ii)&nbsp;the number
of&nbsp;days from the prior anniversary of the Grant Date to the next anniversary of the Grant Date. The portion of the SAR so vested may be exercised by the Grantee until the earlier of
(i)&nbsp;the third anniversary of the date of Retirement, or (ii)&nbsp;the end of the SAR Period. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>(e)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Termination for Other Reasons.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the Grantee terminates
employment during the Term for any reason other than cause, Disability, death, or Retirement the SARs may be exercised by the Grantee until the earlier of (i)&nbsp;three (3)&nbsp;months following
the date of such termination of employment, or (ii)&nbsp;the end of the Term. In any such case, the SARs may be exercised only as to the shares which had become exercisable on or before the date of
termination of employment. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>(f)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Designation of Beneficiary.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Grantee may designate a
beneficiary by completing a beneficiary designation from approved by the Company and delivering the completed designation form to the Human Resources Department of the Company. The person who is the
Grantee's named beneficiary at the time of his or her death (herein referred to as the "Beneficiary") shall be entitled to exercise the SARs, to the extent it is exercisable, after the death of the
Grantee within the time limits set forth above. The Grantee may from time to time revoke or change his or her Beneficiary without the consent of any prior Beneficiary by filing a new designation with
the Human Resources Department of the Company. The last such designation received by the Company will be controlling; provided, however, that no designation, or change or revocation thereof, shall be
effective unless received by the Company prior the Grantee's death, and in no event shall any designation be effective as of a date prior to such receipt. If the Company is in doubt as to the right of
any person to exercise the SARs, the Company may refuse to recognize such exercise, without liability for any
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=3,EFW="2159467",CP="FRONTIER AIRLINES, INC.",DN="7",CHK=800764,FOLIO='3',FILE='DISK122:[05DEN6.05DEN2116]TA2116A.;15',USER='DTAYLOR',CD='14-JUN-2005;10:56' -->
<A NAME="page_ta2116_1_4"> </A>
interest or dividends thereon, until the Compensation Committee of the Company's Board of Directors (the "Committee") determines the person entitled to exercise such SARs, which determination shall be
final and conclusive. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>8.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Automatic Exercise of SARs.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Immediately prior to the
termination of SARs, as provided in Section&nbsp;1(o) or Section&nbsp;7 above, all SARs that are exercisable immediately prior to the termination will be deemed to have been exercised by the
Grantee with no other act or notice. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>9.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Restriction on Transferability; Nonalienability of Benefits.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>(a)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Limitation on Transferability.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SARs, whether or not vested,
may not be sold, assigned, transferred by gift or otherwise, pledged or hypothecated, or otherwise disposed of, by operation of law or otherwise, and, during the Grantee's lifetime, are exercisable
only by the Grantee or the Grantee's court appointed legal representative. If Grantee has not designated a Beneficiary under Section&nbsp;7(e), or if the designated beneficiary does not survive the
Grantee's death, the SARs will pass by will or the laws of descent and distribution. Following the Grantee's death, the SARs, if otherwise exercisable, may be exercised by the person to whom such
right passes according to the foregoing and such person will be deemed the Grantee for purposes of any applicable provisions of this Agreement. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>(b)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Nonalienation of Benefits.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as provided in subsection
9(a)&nbsp;above, (i)&nbsp;no right or benefit under this Agreement will be subject to anticipation, alienation, sale, assignment, hypothecation, pledge, exchange, transfer, encumbrance or charge,
and any attempt to anticipate, alienate, sell, assign, hypothecate, pledge, exchange, transfer, encumber or charge the same will be void, and (ii)&nbsp;no right or benefit hereunder will in any
manner be liable for or subject to the debts, contracts, liabilities or torts of the Grantee or other person entitled to such benefits. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>10.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>No Rights as a Shareholder.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Grantee will not, by reason
of SARs granted under this Agreement, be deemed for any purpose to be, or to have any of the rights of, a shareholder of the Company or of the Company with respect to any shares of Stock. Upon
exercise of an SAR and the transfer of a share of Stock to the Grantee, the Grantee shall have all of the rights of a shareholder of the Company. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>11.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Adjustments of and Changes in the Common Stock.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The SARs
shall be adjusted as provided in Section&nbsp;11 of the Plan; provided that no adjustment shall be contrary to Code section&nbsp;409A or shall be effected in a manner that would subject the
Grantee to taxes and penalties under Code section&nbsp;409A. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>12.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Restrictions Imposed by Law.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Grantee will not exercise
the SARs, and the Company will not be obligated to cause to be issued any shares of Stock, if counsel to the Company determines that such exercise or issuance would violate any applicable law or any
rule or regulation of any governmental authority or any rule or regulation of, or agreement of the Company with, any securities exchange or association upon which shares of Stock are listed or quoted.
The Company will in no event be obligated to take any affirmative action in order to cause the exercise of the SARs or the resulting payment of cash or issuance of Stock to comply with any such law,
rule, regulation or agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>13.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Notice.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any notice required or permitted to be given under
this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be given by first class registered or certified mail, postage prepaid, or by personal deliver to the appropriate party, address: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><B>(a)</B></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>If to the Company, to Frontier Airlines,&nbsp;Inc., Attention: Corporate Secretary, 7001 Tower Road, Denver, Colorado
80249-7312, or at such other address as may have been furnished to the Grantee in writing by the Company; or </FONT><P><FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=4,EFW="2159467",CP="FRONTIER AIRLINES, INC.",DN="7",CHK=785958,FOLIO='4',FILE='DISK122:[05DEN6.05DEN2116]TA2116A.;15',USER='DTAYLOR',CD='14-JUN-2005;10:56' -->
<A NAME="page_ta2116_1_5"> </A></FONT></P>

</DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><B>(b)</B></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>If to the Grantee, at the address indicated below the Grantee's signature on the last page&nbsp;of this Agreement, or at such other
address as may have been furnished to the Company in writing by the Grantee. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any
such notice shall be deemed to have been given in as of the second day after deposit in the United States mails, postage prepaid, properly addressed as set forth above, in the case
of mailed notice, or as of the date delivered in the case of personal delivery. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>14.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Amendment.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding any other provision hereof, this
Agreement may be supplemented or amended from time to time as approved by the Committee. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, without the consent of the Grantee, this Agreement may be
amended or supplemented from time to time as approved by the Committee (i)&nbsp;to cure any ambiguity or to correct or supplement any provision herein which may be defective or inconsistent with any
other provision herein, or (ii)&nbsp;to make such other changes as the Company, upon advice of counsel, determines are necessary or advisable because of the adSAR or promulgation of, or change in or
of the interpretation of, any law or governmental rule or regulation, including Section&nbsp;409A of the Code and any applicable federal or state securities laws; and subject to any required action
by the Board or the stockholders of the Company, and subject to the limitation of any federal or state law tax or securities laws, the SARs granted under this Agreement may be canceled by the Company
and a new grant made in substitution therefor, provided that the grant so substituted will satisfy all of the requirements of the Plan as of the date such new grant is made and no such action will
adversely affect any SARs to the extent then exercisable. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>15.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Rights to Employment.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Nothing contained in this Agreement,
and no action of the Company or the Committee with respect hereto, will confer or be construed to confer on the Grantee any right to continue in the employ of the Company or interfere in any way with
the right of the Company to terminate the Grantee's employment at any time, with or without cause, subject to the provisions of any employment agreement between the Grantee and the Company. This
Agreement is limited solely to governing the rights and obligations of the Grantee with respect to the SARs. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>16.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Governing Law.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Agreement will be governed by, and
construed in accordance with, the internal laws of the State of Colorado. Each party irrevocably submits to the general jurisdiction of the state and federal courts located in the State of Colorado in
any action to interpret or enforce this Agreement and irrevocably waives any objection to jurisdiction that such party may have based on inconvenience of forum. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>17.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Grantee Acceptance.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Grantee will signify acceptance of
the terms and conditions of this Agreement by signing in the space provided at the end hereof and returning a signed copy to the Company.
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=5,EFW="2159467",CP="FRONTIER AIRLINES, INC.",DN="7",CHK=413717,FOLIO='5',FILE='DISK122:[05DEN6.05DEN2116]TA2116A.;15',USER='DTAYLOR',CD='14-JUN-2005;10:56' -->
<A NAME="page_ta2116_1_6"> </A></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>IN WITNESS WHEREOF</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the parties have executed this Agreement as of the day and year first above written. </FONT></P>
